evidence: Single package structure with clear module separation (CYNITE, database)
High average fan-out (5.875) indicating dense inter-module communication typical of monoliths
Maximum directory depth of 2 suggests flat module organization
Database modules directly coupled with business logic modules
Shared utilities and info modules used across components
No evidence of service boundaries or API-based communication patterns
risks: Tight coupling between database and business logic modules
High fan-out may indicate difficult maintainability
Direct database access from multiple modules increases complexity
